original_text: The basic rationale for this legislation -- that current law hopelessly ties the hands of federal agencies -- is outdated at best . Concerns about bottlenecks in the approval process led to important recent reforms to expedite meritorious projects . The Forest Service devolved approval authority down to individual national forest managers . The 2014 Farm Bill authorized expedited project approval in areas threatened by fire , disease , or insect infestation . The Forest Service has designated about one-quarter of all national forest land as eligible for this authority , which meets emergencies without jettisoning environmental concerns .
text: The basic reason for this legislation – the existing law hopelessly linked to the hands of federal agencies – is at best obsolete. During the approval process, concerns over bottlenecks have led to major recent reforms to speed up meritorious projects. The Forest Service will transfer the authorized authorities to individual national forest managers. The Farm Act of 2014 authorizes expedited approval of the project in areas threatened by fire, disease or insect infection. The Forest Service has designated about a quarter of national forest land as eligible for that authority, and the agency has encountered emergencies without having to abandon environmental issues.

original_text: Sweden went another way . In 1999 , it passed a law to criminalize the buyers of sex , but not the sellers . Sex-trade workers were encouraged to report abusive clients to police , and given assistance to help them find other lines of work . ( Or , in the case of migrant women who 'd been trafficked , to return home . ) The law is not unlike Canada 's new law , which has been widely derided as unworkable , unconstitutional , dangerous to women and hopelessly reactionary . But then nobody ever accused the Harper government of being progressive .
text: Sweden is leaving again. In 1999, it passed a law that criminalized buyers of sexual behavior, not sellers. Sex trade workers are encouraged to report abuse to the police and provide assistance to help them find other jobs. (Or, for the return of trafficked immigrant women to their hometowns.) The law is no different from the new Canadian law, which is widely ridiculed as an infeasible, unconstitutional, dangerous and hopeless reaction to women. But no one then accused the Harper administration of progress.

original_text: Myth 6 : Bedbugs prefer unsanitary , urban conditions " Bedbugs are terribly nondiscriminatory , " Schal says . The prevalence of the bugs in low-income housing is therefore not a result of the insect 's preference , but of dense populations and the lack of money to pay for proper elimination strategies . " Any location is vulnerable , " Kells says . " But some people are going to have a harder time getting control of them because it is such an expensive treatment . "
text: Misunderstanding 6: Bedbugs prefer unsanitary urban conditions. From high-rise buildings in ritzy to homeless shelters, bed bugs can be found. Therefore, the prevalence of bugs in low-income housing is not the result of insect preference, but rather a dense population and a lack of money for appropriate elimination strategies. “Any position is vulnerable,” Kells said. “But some people will have a hard time controlling them because it’s an expensive treatment.”

original_text: Society is vulnerable to extreme weather . The United Nations body whose job it is to assess the science on climate change says the North Atlantic and Western North Pacific will see more strong storms like Typhoon Haiyan that tore through the Philippines in 2013 . In Europe , heat waves like the 2003 event , which killed 70,000 people , are already 10 times more likely than a decade ago , and this pattern is set to continue . Scientists also know that warmer air will mean rainfall in heavier bursts , while higher seas will make storms more likely to breach coastal flood defenses .
text: Society is susceptible to extreme weather. The work of the United Nations agency is to assess the science of climate change shows that the North Atlantic and North Pacific will see more intense storms, such as the typhoon sea breeze that Haiyan tore in the Philippines in 2013. In Europe, like the 2003 event, the 70,000-person craze was 10 times that of a decade ago, and this model will continue. Scientists also know that warm air will mean rainfall in heavier outbreaks, while higher oceans will make storms more likely to disrupt coastal flood control.

original_text: But the current politically correct left approach is quite peculiar if we think about history . text: But the current politically correct left-hand approach is very peculiar if we consider history. Of course, Marx teased Malthus (Marx himself lived a large family in poverty), but after him some progressives who called themselves Neo-Malthusians competed against the influence of the church and conservatives to advocate for a decrease in the number of children in poor families. They fought harshly by the authorities in the context of the pre-World War: Nationalism requires many soldiers, and the number is real power. After two wars, this political current disappears, and strangely, the state adopts large family values, whether run by "left" or "right".

original_text: ISLAMABAD : The federal government has announced the launch of a low-cost housing scheme for shelter less and homeless people in 11 districts of Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa . According to available information , a total of 294 and 214 kanal of land has already been acquired in Abbottabad and Haripur respectively for this project . Radio Pakistan reported . The federal ministry for housing has directed the deputy commissioners of districts concerned to expedite the process of the transfer of land to the housing foundation for the project . text: Islamabad: The federal government has announced a low-cost housing plan to reduce shelter and homelessness in 11 areas of Khyber-Pakhtunkhwa. According to the available information, the project has acquired a total of 294 and 214 lands in Abbottabad and Haripur, respectively. Pakistan Radio reported. The Federal Department of Housing has directed the deputy directors of the districts to speed up the process of transferring land to the housing foundation for the project. The project was conceived in 1999 and has not seen the light of the day yet.

original_text: We argue that there is a real danger that family ' hubs ' work as a form of ' therapeutic incarceration ' both institutionalising and reducing the functioning capacity of families . Ireland has a long history of gendered forms of social violence inflicted on poor mothers and children who were made invisible , incarcerated and excluded from society . We caution that hubs may be a new form of institutionalisation of vulnerable women and children , and poor families ( predominantly lone parent mothers ; and working class , migrant and ethnic-minority women ) . Therefore , we recommend that families should not be left in hubs for longer than three months . They should be provided suitable social housing within that time and there should be a sunset clause for family hubs , to be closed by 2019 .
text: We believe that family “hub” is a real danger as a form of “treatment incarceration.” Ireland has a long history of gender-based social violence against poor mothers and children, who are considered invisible, imprisoned and excluded from society. We warn that hubs may be a new form of institutionalization of vulnerable women and children, as well as poor families (mainly lonely parents and mothers; and working class, immigrants and ethnic minority women). Therefore, we recommend not leaving families in the hub for more than three months. Suitable social housing should be provided at that time and the sunset clause for the family hub should be closed in 2019.

text: The University of Louisville has been actively engaged in various natural disasters in Pakistan. The 2005 earthquake alone left about 86,000 people, and in northern Pakistan another 3 million people were homeless. Dr. Adeel Haq, a senior resident of Emergency Medicine at the University of Louisville School of Medicine, worked tirelessly to raise a $16,000.00 fund. He then went to Battargam, a temporary tent village, where he began serving patients there. His efforts have earned him the award for college medical volunteers. His efforts have raised awareness and urgency to establish branch plans in Pakistan in order to prepare the country for natural disasters.

A centralized system , with a governing third party was , until recently , the only conceivable way to achieve data and transaction transparency . A single organization ca n't be responsible for making data throughout a whole supply chain transparent . NGOs or industry associations do not have the capacity to manage this transparency and if they could they would be a vulnerable target for bribery , social engineering , or targeted hacking .
text: Traceability Challenges to achieve traceability, it is necessary to understand every link in a lengthy supply chain. However, with the help of current systems, the effective interoperability of data along the supply chain poses a huge technical challenge. Until recently, centralized systems with managed third parties were the only conceivable way to achieve data and transaction transparency. An organization is not responsible for transparent data throughout the supply chain. NGOs or industry associations do not have the ability to manage this transparency, and if they can, they will become vulnerable targets for bribery, social engineering, or targeted hacking.

original_text: I help run a nonprofit called Boulder Food Rescue that picks up food that would otherwise be thrown out from grocery stores and caterers and transports it by bicycle to agencies that serve hungry , homeless and low income folks in Boulder , Colorado , USA . We have 120 hard working volunteers who bike food around town , deliver that food to over 50 recipient organization and in the past year and a half have rescued over 250,000 lbs of fresh produce . Our bike powered model is replicable in nearly every city , and we 've created a step by step guide to how to do so ! Thus far , six different cities have adopted our model and we 're always looking for more dedicated people to do the same . Please visit boulderfoodrescue.org for more information about how to start your own bike powered food rescue and begin addressing waste and want at the same time in your hometown !

text: A letter was provided to applicants who did not qualify for the U.S. visa, explaining the Immigration and Nationality Act, and answering several common questions. As stated in the letter, applicants must demonstrate that they do not intend to immigrate to the United States. This includes showing strong family, social or economic ties, as well as demonstrating an individual's intention to stay in the United States for the time being. Officials also assess whether an individual uses his visa for intended purposes, such as visiting, working or going to school. Since the 1950s, the U.S. government has applied this principle of immigration intention to every embassy around the world.

original_text: Dr Mayengbam Lalit Singh Recently honourable PM of India launched scheme called " Doubling Farmers ' Income " in order to uplift the welfare being of larger portion of Indians . The big questions felt by people are ( i ) How would it be possible in short period of time ? And ( ii ) is it an elusive doctrine to sweep vote bank of millions of farmers for upcoming parliamentary election in 2019 ? Across all over India ( except for a few states ) so many rigidities have to be solved in order to raise the real income of farmers . These rigidities are characterised by infrastructures , structures and institutions . The present article focuses on those rigidities only for Manipur which has been lagging behind many Indian states . Regarding infrastructure ( inputs ) , the state is found backward among those backward states of India . Introspecting water infrastructure , the state has been under-utilising water resources despite the abundant availability . For Kharif season crops farmers rely on rain water since the state is under the map of SE monsoon . However , during Rabi and Zayed seasons the state has been witnessing scarcity of water . In order to curb this shortage , government needs construction of multiple check dams and digging bore wells in those small streams flowing across the plain areas . During peak season , there is always a shortage of manures and pesticides due to landslide on national highways . Revolution of organic farming will lessen dependency on chemical fertilisers since the state has high potential of producing organic manures and pesticides . During post harvesting period , the state needs to construct cold storages so that perishable crops can be stored for agricultural off seasons . Regarding financial support to farming , banks are not integrated with farmers . Moreover state government does not organise crop insurance schemes in order to compensate the loss due to natural calamity . My previous article on " Channelizing Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Act ( MGNREGA ) with Crop and Livestock Insurances in India " postulates the model on how to compensate the loss . The second rigid character of farming is that there had been no structural change over decades . Farming in Manipur focuses on production of only coarse cereals which is characterised by immediate consumption . In this era of globalisation farming should have close introspection of demand and supply model of consumers across the world . Especially in hilly areas , cultivation of coarse cereal is just to meet local consumption and not for earning profits . Nowadays , farmers stated cultivation of illegal crops such as poppy illegally in order to earn huge profit . In order to prevent this , government should emphasise on cultivation cash crops such yongchak ( parkia speciosa ) , cardamom , tea , coffee , black pepper , etc. since these crops are highly demanded in international as well as domestic market . On the other hand this can reduce environmental destruction which is followed after short period zoom cultivation . In plain areas also main crops are also coarse cereals which are vulnerable to low profit . Farmers should diversify in cultivation of cash crops such as black rice , medicinal plants , oil seeds , mushrooms , etc . Moreover farmers should engage themselves in nonfarm sectors wherein both farm and nonfarm sectors can be fitted in supply and demand schedule for their inputs and outputs . One of the institutional rigidities faced by the farmers is asymmetric information on the technological development in agricultural sector . Krishi Vigyan Kendras ( KVKs ) had been instituted in every districts across India in order to fill the information gap between farmers and agricultural scientists . However their works had been found confined to laboratories only and their expertises are hardly in the knowledge domain of farmers . Government should frame policies for KVKs so that they should be available to farmers at least once in a week on alternative blocks . Another institutional rigidity we witness is financial inaccessibility of farmers to existing financial institutions ( banks ) . In India , banks are found to release funds to manufacturing and service sectors but not on agricultural sector . Too much official procedures and rigid financial securities create inaccessibility of farmers to banks . So the banks should be advised to make survey on the constructive environment wherein farmers should accede and return loans in time . Another important institutional rigidity is lack of marketing institutions such as marketing farms and agents which can deal in such agricultural products . Government should invite both local and nonlocal farms which can link farmers with consumers at price determined by market rate . Government also should have policies such as Minimum Support Price and construction of Cold Storages so that various types of agricultural products can be available during their offseason . The last most important institutional rigidities is inability of government to constitute an integral body which comprises above mentioned farmers body , financial institutes , KVKs , Marketing farms and government funded research institutes . If the integral body function with mutual exchange of workings with all institutional constituents , dream of " Doubling Farmers ' Income " can be achieved . Let this article may draw attention of Agricultural Ministry in fulfilling its ambition .

original_text: With migrants and refugees in many parts of Europe facing such hostility and inhumanity , the people of the tiny island of Tilos , in Greece , have shown it is entirely possible to welcome them in dignity and with respect . Despite the country 's recession and severe cuts in public spending , municipal authorities , assisted by NGOs and many local volunteers , have taken in families requesting asylum and candidates for relocation to other EU countries -- integrating the children in the local school and enabling adults to seek work . I honour and commend this example of human decency .
text: As migrants and refugees in many parts of Europe face such hostile and inhumane behavior, the people of the Greek island of Tilos have shown that it is possible to welcome them in dignity and respect. Despite the country’s recession and severe reduction in public spending, municipalities have hired families asking for asylum and candidates to relocate to other EU countries, with the assistance of NGOs and many local volunteers – to include children in local schools and enable adults to seek jobs. I respect and praise the example of human decent.

original_text: The bill had been proposed in May 2015 , but faced obstruction in the Punjab assembly . According to Punjab government , the bill is comprehensive and brings several previously ignored offences within its ambit , and covers domestic violence , emotional , economic and psychological abuse , cyber crime , stalking and abetting of offenders . Unlike previous laws , it introduces an ingenious implementation mechanism . It proposes the setting up of 24-hour , women-run , district violence-against-women centres . The centres will have all required services , including first aid , police reporting , FIR lodging , prosecution , medical examination , forensics and post-trauma rehabilitation under one roof , and accessible to women . A toll-free helpline will be set up where women could call for assistance , legal advice , prompt evidence collection and immediate protection .
text: The bill was introduced in May 2015 but faces obstacles in the Punjab Parliament. According to the Punjab government, the bill is comprehensive and brings to the crimes that have previously ignored it and covers domestic violence, emotional, economic and psychological abuse, cybercrime, stalking and the teaching of criminals. Unlike previous laws, it introduced a clever implementation mechanism. It proposes the establishment of a 24-hour women-run regional violence-response center. These centers will provide all necessary services including first aid, police reports, for accommodation, prosecution, medical examination, forensics and women can use after recovery after recovery under a roof. A free telephone hotline will be established where women can seek help, legal advice, timely collection of evidence and immediate protection.

She wants to continue to help these people and act as role models.

original_text: Nigeria is a key focus country for the universal financial access agenda . The UFA 2020 goal -- recognizing financial access as a basic building block to managing an individual 's financial life -- aims to provide all adults worldwide with access to a transaction account or an electronic instrument to store money and to send and receive payments . Access to a transaction account is a first step toward broader financial inclusion , which helps poor families escape poverty and afford such essential social services as water , electricity , housing , education and health care , as well as helping small firms to expand operations .
text: Nigeria is a key focus country on the universal financial visit agenda.
